messages.subject: Q1 Project Planning Meeting Follow-up
messages.body:
Hi team,

Thanks for attending today's planning meeting. Here are the action items:

1. Bob - finalize the project timeline
2. Charlie - prepare the budget proposal
3. Alice - schedule follow-up meeting

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Alice

messages.subject: Re: Q1 Project Planning Meeting Follow-up
messages.body:
Hi Alice,

Thanks for the summary! I'll have the project timeline ready by Thursday EOD. Quick question - should I include the buffer time we discussed for the development phase?

Also, I'll need input from Charlie on resource allocation before I can finalize dates.

Best,
Bob

messages.subject: Re: Q1 Project Planning Meeting Follow-up
messages.body:
Bob and Alice,

I'm working on the budget proposal now. Bob, I'll send you the resource allocation details by Wednesday morning so you can factor that into the timeline.

Alice - I may need an extra day for the budget. Can we push the follow-up meeting to next Tuesday instead of Monday?

Thanks,
Charlie

messages.subject: Re: Q1 Project Planning Meeting Follow-up
messages.body:
Perfect! Bob - yes, please include the buffer time.

Charlie - Tuesday works great. I've moved the follow-up meeting to Tuesday at 2 PM. Calendar invite updated.

Looking forward to seeing everything come together!

Alice

messages.subject: Quarterly Performance Review Scheduled
messages.body:
Dear Employee,

Your quarterly review has been scheduled for next Friday at 2 PM. Please prepare your self-assessment and be ready to discuss your achievements and goals for the upcoming quarter.

Meeting Location: Conference Room B
Duration: 1 hour

Please confirm your attendance.

Best regards,
HR Department

messages.subject: Re: Quarterly Performance Review Scheduled
messages.body:
Hi HR Team,

Thank you for scheduling this. I have a conflict at 2 PM on Friday - I have a client call that I cannot reschedule.

Would it be possible to move this to Thursday at 3 PM or Friday at 10 AM? I apologize for the inconvenience.

Best regards,
Employee

messages.subject: Re: Quarterly Performance Review Scheduled
messages.body:
Hi Employee,

No problem! I've rescheduled your review to Thursday at 3 PM in Conference Room B. Your manager has been updated on the calendar.

See you then!

Best regards,
HR Department

messages.subject: Updated API Documentation
messages.body:
Hi Dev Team,

Here's the updated documentation for the API endpoints. I've added examples for all the new features we discussed last week.

Key updates:
- New authentication endpoints
- Webhook configuration guide
- Rate limiting documentation
- Code examples in Python, JavaScript, and Go

Let me know if you need any clarifications or have questions.

Best regards,
Sarah

messages.subject: Re: Updated API Documentation
messages.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for the documentation! I have a couple of questions:

1. For the new OAuth2 flow, do we need to register our callback URLs somewhere?
2. The rate limiting mentions "per API key" - does this mean per application or per user?
3. I noticed the webhook signature verification example uses HMAC-SHA256. Is this mandatory or can we use other algorithms?

Also, could you add an example for pagination? The docs mention it but don't show how to use the cursor parameter.

Thanks!
Mike

messages.subject: Re: Updated API Documentation
messages.body:
Hi Mike,

Great questions! Let me address each:

1. OAuth2 callbacks - Yes, you'll need to register them in the developer portal under Settings > OAuth Configuration. I'll add a note about this in the docs.

2. Rate limiting - It's per API key, which maps to per application. Each app gets 1000 requests/hour. If you need user-level limits, we have a separate enterprise tier.

3. HMAC-SHA256 is mandatory for security reasons. We require this to ensure webhook authenticity.

Good catch on pagination! I'll add a comprehensive example with cursor-based pagination by end of day.

Anything else?

Best,
Sarah

messages.subject: Re: Updated API Documentation
messages.body:
Perfect, that clears everything up! Thanks for the quick response.

Looking forward to the pagination examples.

Cheers,
Mike
